titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the University Art Gallery Records, 1938-2005 UA.90.8.16.1
titlestmt.author: Cassidee Knott.

did.unittitle: University Art Gallery Records

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: University of Pittsburgh. University Art Gallery

did.abstract: The University Art Gallery manages the University of Pittsburgh's art collection and regularly hosts exhibitions of artwork. This collection contains information and catalogs for many of the exhibits hosted by the University Art Gallery from 1938 to 2005.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: University Art Gallery Records, 1938-2005, UA.90.8.16.1, University Archives, Archives & Special Collections, University of Pittsburgh Library System

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: The University of Pittsburgh holds the property rights to the material in this collection, but the copyright may still be held by the original creator/author. Researchers are therefore advised to follow the regulations set forth in the U.S. Copyright Code when publishing, quoting, or reproducing material from this collection without the consent of the creator/author or that go beyond what is allowed by fair use.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This collection contains information and catalogs for many of the exhibits hosted by the University Art Gallery from 1938 to 2005.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was processed by Thaddeus J. Kotarski III in August 2017 and Cassidee Knott in June 2018.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Deposited by the University Art Gallery in 2012 and 2015.

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: The University Art Gallery (UAG) can trace its origins to the relocation of the University of Pittsburgh's Fine Arts Department to the seventh floor of Cathedral of Learning in 1937. When the department moved into the Cathedral of Learning there was also space for the Fine Arts Library and a small gallery for temporary exhibitions. Upon completion of the Henry Clay Frick Fine Arts Building in 1965, the UAG relocated to that space.

The UAG maintains the University of Pittsburgh art collection, which totals over 3,000 objects. Drawing from the University's holdings, as well as those of other museums and traveling exhibits, UAG hosts several exhibitions each year. Other shows feature work completed by University faculty and students.

controlaccess.subject: University of Pittsburgh
controlaccess.corpname: University of Pittsburgh. University Art Gallery

did.unittitle: Exhibitions of the University Art Gallery

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series contains files on many of the exhibits held by the University Art Gallery from 1938 to 2005. These files contain records pertaining to the planning of the exhibtis, including correspondence, loan information, provenance research, and more. Also included are the exhibit catalogs, which provide information about the pieces of art that were part of each exhibit.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series contains catalogs for University Art Gallery exhibits for which we do not have the complete exhibit files.
